essay0: in many ways, i'm very urban even though i spent the first 15 years of my life in the french countryside. i love most of the things a city has to offer, the vibrancy and the liveliness that comes with the city life and i'm particularly fond of sf. just like most city-living women, i enjoy savoring a scrumptious meal with friends out in the city, going to a show or museum, dancing and i share the same mostly contained addiction for shoes and handbags than 80% of urban women. yet and at the risk of confusing you, i'm one of those girls who truly enjoy backpacking in the wilderness for a whole week if i can, away from that same city buzz that i like so much. i enjoy solitude as much as i cherish my social time. i don't think i can be happy without both in my life. i have loved traveling alone (i went on a 6 months solo trip around the world a few years back) and i still do to some extent but these days, i long to travel with a life partner.  so at this time of my life, i am interested in creating a long term, meaningful and evolving relationship with a man whose heart and soul i admire and respect, who exudes a passion for life and who "gets" me and my idiosyncrasies.  i thought i'd list some random things about me in hope that they give you a better idea about who you are dealing with:  - i only sleep on the left side of the bed and on my right side. i have tried other combinations but that's the only one that works well. - i own 3 passports, one of which is completely useless and yet i have a soft side for itmaybe because i always cheer for the underdog. - i have a slight addiction for french dark chocolate. some people bring wine back from their trip to france, i bring dark chocolate. it's lighter and this way i can pack more shoes and handbags i'm pragmatic with my addictions. - i enjoy washing dishes (even though i have a dishwasher). it's very weird but i find that sensual. i love the foam! - i hate putting dishes away - i'll never vote republican in this lifetime. i don't have it in me no matter what amount of taxes democrats make me pay. - i am athletic and i enjoy different types of sports: i play tennis, snowboard, run regularly, do yoga and would like to get back into kite surfing i have a good disposition for sports somehow, maybe because i was a tomboy as a child (i have 2 older brothers, that says it all) and there is still a bit of daredevil in me after all these years. - i absolutely love being on a sail boatanywhere in the worldi'm usually the designated cook for the crew. - i never watch sport on tv or in a stadium (unless it's an atp tennis tournament). - i hardly ever watch tv except for charlie rose and the bbc news. i knowboring but i love charlie. i only watch tv if i am going to learn something. therefore, i'm utterly ignorant about tv series or reality shows - i only drink nespresso coffee. i know i'm a snob. - i can prepare you a delicious french dinner if you are nice to me. the credit goes to my mom who is an exceptional cook. - i love music and dancing. all kinds of music. - i wish i played an instrument, specifically guitar or piano. i'm annoyed by the fact that i don't, aside from playing flute (!) as a childthanks mom, flute was really cool - i like men and women equally and i have great friends on both sides. but to be clear, i only like men romantically! - i'm a hopeless romantic still convinced to the core that the perfect guy (for me) is around the corner. - i was married for 9 years a while back so i have a pretty good idea about the meaning of the word commitment. - i have more kerastase products than most hair salons. i don't know what it is with me and hair products. the tantalizing smell maybe - talking about hair, i occasionally bring a puzzled look on people's face by switching from a straight (hair) classy look to my more natural and sassy curlsi like versatility. - i have a beautiful cat with a great personality. even non-cat lovers fall in love with her. butshe loves men a bit too much and i find myself competing with her for their attention! - i have no skeletons left in my closets. just a few bones here and there. sorry but i'm not perfect. working on it though - i believe in karma, the golden rule and the law of attraction. - like every one else, i'm a bit complex but not complicated. - i'm very feminine and sensual. - i'm fun to be around and for the most part always in a good mood. i'm the happiest i've ever been. - my indulgent friends say that i am warm, genuine and a caring soul. i'm apparently also inquisitive, subtly sexy, passionate about life, with a vibrant energy and an adventurous and positive spirit! - i love my family (they are all in france) and i have an unlimited supply of love for my nephew and niece. i visit them often. - i'm still very french despite the 18 years lived in the us but i'm very different from the french living in franceconfusing maybe but true. - i like smells, the good ones only - i'm running out of idea....

essay0: hi! first of all, if you know what gareth keenan is referring to, i love you.  i'm in grad school at university of michigan. just finished my first year! i'm drawn to the ocean, and hope to eventually relocate to a coast, perhaps of another country. i love ethnic food, coffee, visiting new places, and ceaselessly analyzing everything around me. i crave novel experiences, intelligent people, and dynamic surroundings.  sometimes, i'm kind of like an old man. i like to wake up in the morning, read the financial times, and drink coffee. paradoxically, it's extremely difficult for me to get up early, but when i do, i find it very enjoyable.  i'm very ambitious and competitive. also, i probably love money and power. but, i temper it with my empathy for others, so i'm not completely soulless. i dwell on the future, and love to find things to look forward to.  a few summers ago i worked for an airline, got free flights, and traveled the world. i stayed in hostels, which despite the stigma eli roth gave it in hostel, are by far the best way to travel. they're cheap and you get to hang out with remarkably diverse groups of really chill foreigners.  i ended up living in hawaii for a summer in my year off on the big island, and i hope to spend my next semester studying in hong kong.  i am free-spirited, articulate, and delicious

essay0: hmm. no matter what i type, in the end i always feel like i can never fully explicate who i am at the core. but that would be no fun. everyone's got their secrets! it's nice to keep an air of mystery sometimes... anyways, my name is nikki and i'm a 23 year old student living in hayward, ca. i've lived in the bay area all my life (i was born in san francisco and then moved to hayward when i was 11).  i am passionate, idealistic, and crazy  edit: sweet, i haven't been on this thing for 2 years! so, let's update!  yes, my name is still nikki, and no i am not 23! haven't been since 2009, so you do the math! if you can't do simple math then you're automatically out!  i'm still passionate, idealistic and crazy --but a lot wiser! i'm not aiming to please everyone: if you can put up with all my sides --ugly, beautiful, bitchy, impulsive, illogical, sweet, opinionated, etc... -- then you are deserving of me, and you will get back waaayyyy more than you give. i can honestly say you're gonna get the better end of the deal (i'm joking, kinda).  i have no patience for ignoramuses who are stuck in their ways and will never learn, or have no desire to improve and expand their horizons.  honestly, i want to grow as a person. if you can't give me anything substantial or engage me into interesting conversation, then you needn't message me. i'm not settling for anything less than what i deserve. you could honestly be the hottest guy, and if everything that comes out of your mouth is either:  a.) stupid b.)close-minded c.)arrogant d.) un-interesting e.) narcissistic f.) all of the above  ... then hell no.  so, if you're not scared off, then message me. =)

essay0: i grew up in the central valley, and went through nine years of catholic school. graduated from uc davis and ended up in the bay area about nine years ago. i consider myself a relatively well fleshed out adult, i know what i like, how to take care of myself and who i trust. i try to be as loyal and reliable as possible. i like to plan, but i like adventures too. am pretty down to earth. nothing like driving through the farm land of the san joaquin valley to remind myself where i came from. i enjoy the arts of all types (i was an art history major afterall), going to museums, performing arts and live shows. love the outdoors, hiking and camping and need to get my first backpacking trip under my belt. have been known to dabble in yoga and homebrewing.

essay0: i was born and raised in philadelphia and attended college in baltimore where i graduated in may 2011. i moved to sf in january, to pursue music, i play in a band called vinyl spectrum (http://www.facebook.com/vinylspectrum) . i have been playing guitar for about 9 years and music is my passion. i feel it is important to have a way to express yourself creatively and to letting my emotions out through songs is my way to express. i also write screen plays as well.  i have worked in nyc for a bit at emi music group: capitol & virgin records & blue note records, but came out here to make it as a musician and writer. i have a bachelors degree in pr and marketing and a minor in audio and video production. i am currently working at a media publishing company doing product marketing, while also trying to break through as an artist.  i am a romantic, very outgoing and i love meeting new people and creating new experiences. i am hoping to find someone who likes to have a good time and has great taste in music, movies and enjoys trying new things. i am also looking for someone that i can hold a meaningful conversation with and someone who is not afraid to talk about anything that is on her mind. a girl who enjoys watching sports is also a plus.  i look forward to meeting some interesting people.

essay0: area man seeks woman for boggle, happiness  (ap) oakland, ca - at the mild urgings of friends, local man joins okcupid in search of someone with whom to enjoy music, adventure, thought-provoking conversation, and laughter. attempts at witty banter will be made. the pondering of perfect email subject lines will occur.  but seriously rather than start with my dreams, fears, and where i grew up, perhaps i'll just describe what i'm doing now. i'm sitting in my apartment listening to a playlist (radiohead, sleater-kinney, the shins, django reinhardt...). on my desk are scribbled notes for new songs i'm working on. to my right are two paintings that i need to re-hang. they represent my first art purchase, and i bought them last year in mexico city. i successfully convinced my friend to forgo the resort/tourist scene so we could wade into the pace and fascinations of one of the biggest cities in the world. it was a blast, and i got food poisoning. to my left is a stack of new yorkers with which i vainly struggle to keep up.  i went to high school, college and grad school in the bay area, so i've got some great friends, but no special someone. i'd love to find a fulfilling and happy long-term relationship.
essay1: last weekend, after curing malaria (actually easier than it sounds), i fed blind orphans (harder than it sounds) and wrote and sung a song on the guitar to my mom for her birthday (tip: don't use the phrase pimp-daddiest in a mom-song, even if it rhymes).  ok, in reality, i work for a company that helps public schools with financial and business issues so they can focus on educating kids. i love working with schools and am constantly inspired by people who forgo fortune and status to teach. i'm building a career that is socially meaningful, stimulating, challenging and fun. i've worked in the non-profit, for-profit, and government arenas, and believe it's the union of all three that can truly make a difference.  in the past, my jobs have included think tank researcher, rural economic developer, and management consultant. perhaps someday i'll top the expectations set by my first real job - taco bell cashier.  i also wrote a novel last year! it was for national novel writing month which is probably the greatest thing ever. of course, i would never subject someone to reading it since it's terrible. i also play guitar and write music.
essay5: i'm passionate about the electoral college system! the tradition, the process, the potential for wild and unjust misrepresentation! truth be told, i enjoy funny movies/shows (30 rock, daily show, parks and rec, louis, wes anderson, the office, peep show), music, books, and the like. i often pet the neighbors' dogs and cats because i don't have pets myself. other great things are... stimulating conversations with friends, musical instruments, games, dancing and rocking out, hiking, meditation, yoga, museums, theater, traveling, learning things, and turkey jerky.  of course, i love my family, friends, good health, and the fortune i've had so far.
essay9: you like exactly the same pastimes, brand of toilet paper, and olympic events as me except for 1-2 things that we can have long-standing, yet amusingly endearing arguments about.  but really, i hope i'm not coming off as too sarcastic or snarky in this profile. because i do believe that it's worth the search, wait, and occasional heartbreak to find someone whom you smile to see even on day 12 of a road trip where everything has gone wrong. someone who holds compassionate and reasoned beliefs and can thoughtfully discuss a subject. someone with whom you can laugh even while waiting in a long dmv line.  perhaps you are a secret karaoke/shower singer or will occasionally humor my attempts to play and sing 80's songs in punk/bluegrass styles. perhaps we can go camping, discover quirky film festivals, plan traveling adventures, or just joke about the day's events. most importantly, we can always be on each other's side in the face of good times and bad.  or perhaps you hate romance but want to play music with someone.

essay0: yesterday, i met a newly married couple on a ski lift in northstar-at-tahoe who told me this was the best website for meeting fun and active people. so here i am, trying it out. i am a single woman who is outgoing and adventurous. i enjoy meeting new people, having fun, trying new things and enjoying life. i work out regularly, ski, hike and, recently, i completed a 100 mile bike challenge for the leukemia & lymphoma society. i am involved in many social and service programs and activities through my church and non-profit organizations. i have been widowed for 20 years and raised two terrific boys, now married and on their own. so i'm ready to explore friendship with someone who will add even more joy to my life and my journey ahead. i believe a good friendship is the place to start and if love follows, that would be a dream come true.  i am outgoing, thoughtful, and caring
essay1: i enjoy learning and discovering all that life has to offer. i am an optimist and enthusiastic about life. i enjoy my job, my family and my friends. i am having the time of my life since my children have grown and are on their own. i enjoy my home and entertaining my family and friends in it. my life is simple and my heart is grateful for all that life has offered me. i love to snow ski, ride my road bike, hike, ballroom dance, be with friends, listening to music and enjoy the moment whatever it might be.
essay2: knowing what is important to me and what my values are. i am good at expressing my thoughts and feelings. i am good at hearing other points of view and enjoy a good conversation that will expand my thinking and views. i am a really good friend and enjoy the quality relationships i have in my life. i am really good at being an encourager and seeing the glass half full not half empty.
essay3: i can strike up a conversation with just about anybody. i am kind, thoughtful, outgoing, friendly and easy to talk to.
essay4: i am always reading one or two books at the same time. one might be a historical fiction and the other a book to stretch my thinking. i enjoy reading christian authors and the bible. i enjoy a good movie but choose the ones i watch carefully. i enjoy music especially live performances. i love a wide variety of music from easy rock, jazz, rock and roll, classical, to name a few. i love all types of food and like trying different foods from other parts of the world.
essay5: my community of family and friends....i don't need much to be happy and content. i have way too much stuff but i am extremely grateful for what i have.
essay6: the people in my life. i think about how i can use my life to make a difference. i believe one small act of kindness goes a long way. i spend a lot of my free time volunteering and encouraging others. i think about how i can simplify my life so i can spend more time doing the things i enjoy. i believe if i keep doing the things i enjoy, someone special will come into my life and add even more joy and adventure.
essay7: i enjoy dancing both ballroom and free style, during the summer months i enjoy going to downtown street dances. i often will meet a friend for dinner, a movie, or go to the gym and relax in the jacuzzi after a good workout and a busy week of work.

essay0: i am an artist (she says, trying not to sound pretentious, and realizing that tone of voice [or rather, tone of thought] fails [miserably so] to be conveyed by pixels). i am musical (in my way), and i am wordy (clearly), but shy... oh, so shy. creating and making is (collectively is, is with the and, i just can't bring myself to say "are" and sound redundant...) the most important thing to me...it is something i am always doing and something i will never sacrifice no matter the circumstance. rain is, by far, the most beautiful weather, and stilts are fantastic contraptions (along with music boxes, scissors, pop-up books, and pens, to name a few). i enjoy grammar and intelligence and insist on childlike joy. i'm losing my train of thought now, as tends to happen, and will inevitably re-write this entirely in the not-too-distant future (she said years ago)...  i am desperately fascinated with caving, though i have only just (just in the scheme of things, 8 months or so, 8 months out of the thousands and thousands of years it took these places to come into being) started learning and exploring in any way beyond scrambling around various european islands with a flashlight and a sandwich looking for promising holes in hills and cliffs...that, and the tourist-(ugh)-friendly caves in southern france which i just could not resist seeing...they were truly, without any doubt, the most beautiful and moving places i have ever seen. i am also severely enamored of old buildings, tunnels, ruins, castles and the like, the harder to find, the better. i am not a crowd-friendly girl.  i am a bit of an environmentalist (more in daily practice and habit than in grandiose acts of protest or campaign). i insist on recycling, energy saving, etc., i cannot stand the thought of living without a garden (even when all i have is a single room in an apartment i have plants [mostly edible] growing on windowsills in old paper coffee cups that looked too useful to toss with the trash). i ride my bike constantly (when i'm home, that is...), i don't drive, nor do i even know how. i love public transit (and miss those cities with fantastically developed systems, old cities, human cities....), i seek out organic and animal-friendly products when i have to buy things as opposed to creating them myself. there is more, but it hardly seems worth the explanation...if you are the same, you understand. if not...  i am a hoarder, a collector, and packrat, though not in the sense of wasting money on trinkets and nicknacks from souvenir shops. i save supplies and materials, mainly, and get what i can for free. i have 4 typewriters (all given to me or found on the street), countless yards (bookshelves and basins full) of fabric should i feel the need to make something, scraps of paper, every note written to me, paints galore, a huge dresser full of different kinds of tea, old photos, odd instruments, relics of old hobbies, microscopes, etc. etc. i have no clue why i chose to list the things i did, they are but a drop in the huge bucket that is my pile of stuff.  that being said, i can (and have) live(d) quite minimally, as i discovered trekking about eurolandia for 6 months with just my backpack. i still cooked nearly every meal and created things and played music along the way. it was quite lonely, though...  again with the train of thought escaping me...  i am musical, artistic, and strange
essay1: enjoying the percussive/resonant properties of random objects when struck (and singing cave formations - they exist!), savoring the feeling of a hot or cold beverage moving through me, letting the rain hit under my fingernails, on the inside of my elbow, the bottoms of my feet...anywhere that isn't usually touched, babbling semi-coherently in hopes of weeding out those who won't tolerate it and catching the attention of those who might...  i am making chickens out of felt, making music out of instruments and non-instruments alike, reading, growing, learning, cooking, gardening, singing, planning, exploring, making, always making, writing, capturing, doodling, painting, scribbling, typing, speaking, playing, enjoying...  a bit more literally, i spend most days in my studio making art with the hopes of living solely off the "profits" some day. i take work and commissions where i find them, and so far have been keeping myself afloat. the last real "job" i had was making costumes and putting actors in said costumes, and i loved every minute of it. i live within my means and am perfectly capable of supporting myself, so don't be misled by that "last real job" bit.
essay2: though it just seems wrong to proclaim myself "really good" at any of these things when i know there are true geniuses out there, i'll do my best to list a few.  i can cook. don't get me wrong, i would never pass the test of any discerning trained chef, but i can cook. fortunately, i tend only to cook for myself (and i do that daily, for every meal if possible) and the occasional friend. i love experimenting with ingredients, and i greatly enjoy cooking for people with "restricted" diets, be it by choice or necessity. i was a baker once upon time, and some day i will open a small vegan cafe in a beautiful warehouse. yes i will.  i can make things, generic a statement as that may be. i am fidgety as all hell and can't stick with any one skill long enough to become an expert, but i can make things, that is that. i have a bfa that includes sculpture, installation, performance, photography (the good, the real, black and white, celluloid film, hand processing, hand printing, physical processes, giant cameras...), and robots. i enjoy welding and printmaking, sewing (i recently "worked" in a costume shop in a beautiful old theater), making tunnels to explore, creating rooms in which to exist, making jewelry, silversmithing, making animals out of felt, glass blowing, making videos and making music, playing my saw and my shruti box and my pvc shkuhachi (made with love by the one and only taupe armageddon...my dad). there is so much more...
essay3: she is short and, on a good day, her hair is quite a bright shade of orange...
essay4: entirely too many categories for one box!  music (comes first because it is easiest): beirut jeff mangum neutral milk hotel music tapes chocolate usa xiu xiu, the old more than the new jason webley cat stevens beatles mirah cocorosie regina spektor radiohead the odd rasputina corpus callosum, and i suppose that region of the brain as well rufus wainwright bob dylan sufjan stevens port o'brien nin os mutantes dodos scala talking heads 5nizza, piatnica or however you feel like translating that jolie holland  whatever music happens in good irish pubs...  and many others that i would not list generally so much as qualified by specific songs...  (kaolin, elvis perkins, pavement, jorane, zombies, etc.)  and the ever impressive enrique gonzalez...  movies: hedwig and the angry inch (and john cameron mitchell in general). the science of sleep harold and maude breakfast on pluto singin' in the rain once nausicaa of the valley of the wind 28 days later 5th element the adventures of priscilla, queen of the desert  food: i am vegetarian mainly, though i won't attempt to discuss my reasons for that here...ask me if you're truly interested. i enjoy bouts of veganism and raw food binges. mostly, though, i love interesting and varied food, unique food, food i have never tried before...that sort of thing. indian food (yes i realize that is too general a term, but it will have to do for now) is definitely a favorite. i cook quite a lot, i used to be a baker, and some day i will have my own cafe...  books (by far the most difficult category, though possibly the most important): i have had some difficulty in this area...i go in and out of reading phases, but all in all i have had trouble finding books that mean much to me. some of the earliest books that i actually considered treasures were flatland and flatterland i read (past tense) a ton of tolkien, adams and palahniuk while traveling a few years back...all of which i found quite entertaining but none of which was deeply satisfying. i did enjoy dracula and phantom of the opera quite a bit. the first half of camus' the stranger was beautifully written...or perhaps just gorgeously translated. bradbury's dandelion wine (beautiful) ...and i'm currently reading about charles dodgson and his mathematical tricks and puzzles. next on the list is somethin' about the history of english. we'll see how that goes.
essay5: music to listen to and music to create  a means of producing some sort of art  my bike... it takes me everywhere  a kitchen (including tea)  my cats  and finally, fractals.
essay6: non-newtonian fluids, yes!!! (most recent discovery: peanut butter. oh my) and also...time travel, actually. not that i'd want to do such a thing... (don't get me started) and manually (by which i mean, quite literally, mano, etc. etc., by hand, my hand, the touch of a finger...) breaking molecular bonds. sounds like fun (hand through a table, anyone?). wish me luck.
essay7: in my studio making something new...
essay8: is that i've resorted to looking for friends on the internet...o god...
essay9: tough question. if you want to explore caves and ruins and maybe even imaginary places, if you draw, paint, sing, play, make art of any kind... if you want to travel and try new food, if you love cuttlefish and octopods, moonstones and laboradorite, if you know why bubbles have that rainbow skin, if the tactile dome is the most wonderful piece of art you have ever encountered... if you know why my stove is making that bizarre sound... for the most part, if you have something to say (preferably something more substantial than "wut up"), by all means, go ahead! i am genuinely interested in meeting interesting (interested in interesting? really? couldn't do better than that?) people, making friends, and potentially, eventually, meeting someone who may become more. i am very much interested in meeting artists, musicians, circus performers, inventors, writers, fire breathers, metalsmiths, clothing designers, actors, engineers, chefs, crafty types, generally creative people of any kind, really. but know this (apologies for starting a sentence with "but"): i am not looking for a relationship (or sex) right off the bat (that takes time), and i'm also not interested in dating casually, or dating at all, for that matter. in my experiences, the best relationships are with people i have gotten to know well without any expectations regarding the romantic side of things. take that as you will.

essay0: what is it that you want to know about me? there is so much to tell yet where do we begin. let's start off by saying that i am me one of a kind diamond in the rough. you can't be a pea in my pod if your intentions aren't in my best interest & you have ulterior motives. i have made plenty mistakes in my past but i don't regret them not one bit! besides no one in this world is perfect so don't think that for one minute you are able to pass judgment upon me because you are most certainly not able!  through everything i've been through i have become a much better person than i was a few years ago. i've looked over & analyzed my life & all of the decisions that i have made & i can honestly say that i am completely happy with the results. i am a proud mother & my children are the only people that i aim to please.  i can truly say that i am cut from cloth made of silk & gold that from this point on is only meant for the finest king of them all. i believe that a man should be willing to be a man & work hard to get what he wants in life. i believe that a man should stand his ground & be head of household like he is supposed to be without complaint. i also believe that women should learn how to take care of themselves & support themselves as well because if they don't then how can they expect someone else to do it for them? laziness is not an option & neither is ignorance.  i am a woman of high standards & i will not settle for less. i am striving to become successful & i will achieve my success. the type of partner i am looking for & willing to have standing by my side is a man that presents himself as such. he will be a mature, honest, trustworthy, loyal, kind hearted, generous, understanding, non-judgemental, able to communicate, doesn't shut-down, knows how to listen & knows how to get his point across effectively without raising his voice. i'm not looking for perfection but i am looking for a man that lays all his cards out up front (i'll respect you more for telling the truth then if you were to lie to me in my face. even though i may be upset at least you'll still have my respect for being honest.)  so in closing all i can really say is that i am me & i'm not going to change just because you want me to. i will change to please myself & my children & that's all. so you can either accept me as i am or have nothing at all.

essay0: i used to have a blurb up here about how i'm not currently interested in men, but i have apparently failed most miserably at turning off the part of me that is attracted to them. it's the bro-tastic attitude of guys who think with their lower heads that turns me off, not the members themselves. so if any men (keyword here: men, not boys!) are interested, you still have a shot. congratulations. :)  anyway. i'm polyamorous. pansexual. kinky as fuck. i'm a lot to handle but a lot of fun. i can be exploding with excitement one moment and be seductive and sensual the next. i switch in almost every aspect of life. i love surprises and am easily turned on. i also love romance and rainbows and music and bondage and duct tape. and not always in that order, either.  hobby-wise, i used to play the fine sport of roller derby (manda harpoons, #nc-17). not currently on a team, but i still have the skates, the tights, and the attitude. i derp online and i wear weird clothes and amanda palmer eyebrows. i do some fetish modeling and i like to go to play parties. i make my money by being naked but i'm not an easy lay, so go somewhere else if that's what you're here for. i like animals and i love cute things. i like to play my ukulele and daydream and ponder impossible questions. more than most things, i like being tied up and thrown around. i have a couple of tattoos and i'm working on designing more.  i consider myself a female drag queen; that is, i'm outwardly quite femme, but i have a rather impressive dick, as well. ;) his name is the duke of fancy. i'm genderqueer and i identify as a bonersaurus rex. i love androgyny, goth, rainbows, and fetish attire. <3  when i date, i mean seriously have a relationship with someone, my partner(s) have to have roughly my level of confidence and outgoingness (is that a word? it is now.). i seem to have this propensity for attracting people with low self-esteem or poor social skills, who quietly and awkwardly stand by the food table at parties whilst i run around starting conversations and making everybody be friends with everybody else. if you are timid and shy, that's charming and all, but i can't keep you, 'kay? essay1: current projects: editing porn and being mentored as a prodomme. woo.  i just made a huge, dangerous, crazy change in my own life, and am looking forward to finally, for the first time in my life, settling down and focusing on just being me. then perhaps i'll be ready to hop back up and go places again!  long story short, i try to only do things that make me happy. i recently escaped a life where my choices were not my own and i was taught to be ashamed of myself. it's time to live for myself now.  there are a lot of big things i have loosely planned for the next five years or so. go back to japan for a bit, and see some of europe, too. maybe in time for eurovision. take some more college classes, perhaps enough to get a fancy piece of paper for. join a punk band. learn to dj. make a name for myself in the kinky/queer porn world. finally finish a damn craft project. find and maintain a healthy, loving d/s relationship. get lots more tattoos.  so, you know, i plan to be fairly busy. but company always makes the journey more enjoyable. :)
essay2: not knowing what to put in this box. :/ i dunno. i guess i'm pretty brave sometimes. i don't take shit from people and when something upsets me, i actually do something about it. i've recently become what my mentors call a "go-getter." when i want something, i go out. and i try to get it.  my motto is, life is too short to sit around wishing things would get better. there is always an option and a solution. kind people and new experiences are always out there, just waiting for us to find them. my life is never dull anymore.

essay4: books: i am of course a harry potter nerd, and love all of daniel handler's works. i'm a voltaire junkie and i enjoy a good satire. i just devoured the hunger games trilogy, and am waiting for the story of o to get to the good part.  music? this varies so much it's difficult to make any kind of orderly list. bands/musicians that i never tire of are amanda palmer (hence the eyebrows), the dresden dolls, peelander-z, the flaming lips, shonen knife, aesthetic perfection, cee lo green, scissor sisters, kim boekbinder, das ich, beth ditto, operation ivy, evelyn evelyn, oh land, joan jett, e nomine, modest mouse, grendel, reel big fish, the white stripes, my chemical romance, miyavi and ohgr. i love going to shows and clubs (especially goth, industrial, punk, and ska) and good music generally makes me happy in my pants. seriously, i have an enormous boner for live music and throbbing speakers. mmm. throbbing. coincidentally, i meet most of my partners at concerts and clubs. ;)  movies: current favourites are one missed call (the original japanese version, i never saw the remake), contact, role models, the dark knight, whip it, dead snow (zombie nazis - need i say more?), cyrano de bergerac, 10 things i hate about you, repo! the genetic opera, serenity, svankmajer's alice, and the dark crystal.  tim burton used to be my hero; he is dead to me now.  tv shows: weeds, buffy the vampire slayer (vampires. don't. sparkle.), blackadder, firefly, 30 rock, adventure time, rupaul's drag race, better off ted. i am still easing into dr. who. thus far, i find it rather enjoyable.  i always watch the colbert report. that shit is bananas.  food is the easiest. anything with cheese or strawberries on it ought to be good. ;) i'm a picky eater and have been making a concerted effort to eat healthier. just please don't serve me any potatoes.
essay5: romance, kink, cheese, witty conversation, something to read, and knee-highs.  i don't do needy, i don't do sloppy, i don't do rudeness or dishonesty. i value people with integrity who are willing to accept that nobody, themselves included, is perfect. physical appearance is important to me, but i find a lot of things beautiful, and chances are if your insides suit me, so do your outsides. :)

essay0: i am a native california who thinks of himself as an internationalist -- someone who's at home in los angeles, new york, paris, london, tokyo, beirut or dakar. i write for a living, and have written about politics, the arts, and other subjects that i care about passionately. i've traveled around the world many times, and have lived briefly in pakistan and england. i get along well with others who are inspired by international affairs, and who have a sense of humor (though humor is a relative trait). i like encountering surprising things -- whether it's a thoughtful cab driver, a movie that defies expectations, or a plane trip that leads somewhere off the beaten path.
